Figure1_conceptual_overview.description: Conceptual framework for noise-mediated neuroprotection in HIV infection. (A) Clinical paradox: acute vs chronic phase outcomes. (B) Proposed mechanism: noise correlation length modulates enzyme efficiency. (C) Hierarchical Bayesian model structure. (D) Phase-specific noise correlation predictions.

Figure2_posteriors.description: Posterior distributions for noise correlation length (ξ) across infection phases. (A) ξ posteriors showing non-overlapping HDIs. (B) Protection exponent β_ξ posterior. (C) Acute-chronic difference Δξ posterior.

Figure3_model_fit.description: Model fit to clinical MRS constraints across studies and brain regions.

Figure4_protection_factor.description: Protection factor scaling with noise correlation length.

Figure5_diagnostics.description: MCMC diagnostics: trace plots, R-hat, ESS, and posterior predictive checks.

Figure6_convergent_evidence.description: Convergent evidence across independent validation pathways.

SuppFig1_prior_sensitivity.description: Prior sensitivity analysis showing robustness to prior specification.

SuppFig2_power_analysis.description: Statistical power analysis for primary and secondary endpoints.

SuppFig4_subgroup_analysis.description: Subgroup analysis across brain regions and study populations.

SuppFig5_model_comparison.description: 5-model WAIC comparison showing full model dominance.
